summary: Adds more variation, color, and density to Skyrim's stars while trying to stay true to the 'vanilla' night sky.
descriptionHtml:
[size=4][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][center][color=#a4c2f4][size=5]- DESCRIPTION -[/size][/color][/center][center]
[size=3]I was never happy with Skyrim's stars or many of the replacers out there.  I felt that they were often either too bland or too extreme.  That's why I made these textures as a balance between increased fidelity and fantasy.

I figured others might like it too, so here's my take on the night sky with a few extra options to choose from.[/size][/center]


[size=4][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#a4c2f4][size=5]- WHAT DOES IT DO? -[/size][/color][/font][/size]

[size=3]Replaces the default star textures with better density, color, and resolution options

Adds enhancements to constellations based upon Tamrielic lore

Mixes different opacity values, sizes, and maps with 'twinkling' stars in addition to the regular stars for variety[/size]
[/font][/size]

[size=4][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=4][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=4][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#a4c2f4][size=5]- INSTALLATION -[/size][/color][/font][/size][/font][/size]
[code]﻿[/code]
[/font][b]NMM or MO[/b]:  [size=3]Recommended method.  Download and activate in your mod manager of choice.  Follow the on screen instructions and install.[/size]

Manual:  [size=3]Place the textures in your  "Skyrim/data/textures/sky"  folder.  If there are already files there, be sure to make a backup.[/size]  [size=3]To uninstall, remove the 'skystars' and 'constellation' files.[/size]


[size=4][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#a4c2f4][size=5]- COMPATIBILITY -[/size][/color][/font][/size]
[size=3]
[size=4][size=3][font=Lucida Sans Unicode]Stellar should be compatible with ANY mod, as long as it doesn't change the star or constellation files.[/font][/size][/size]

[font=Lucida Sans Unicode]This does NOT replace moons, aurora, or nebulae!  Only the star and constellation textures.

You can mix and match files from other mods if you want, such as galaxies and other stars (just make sure that Stellar overwrites any conflicts)[/font][/size].

[center]
If you use an ENB, or have different brightness settings, your experience may vary!
Be sure to choose the saturation option that is best for you and adjust if necessary. [/center]
[/size]

[size=4][size=4][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#a4c2f4][size=5][center]- OTHER COOL MODS -[/center][/size][/color][/font][/size][/size][center][size=4][size=4][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#a4c2f4][size=5]
[/size][/color][/font][/size][/size][size=3]Check out the following mods to further enhance your nights!  Some of these work very well alongside Stellar, and if you like them, be sure to show these authors some love :D[/size][/center][center][size=3]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25022]Shooting Stars
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/85]Enhanced Night Skyrim
[/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51869]Ethereal Auroras
[/url][/size][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1037]26 Moon Size Tweeks[/url]
[/size][size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54349]Skygazer Moons[/url][/size][/center]
author: PR0JAX
